description: This course focuses on important issues, images, authors, and modes in an intensive study of
racial and multicultural literature in the U.S. The scope of the course can include racial
portraiture, sexual politics, field and factory experience, color and class status, and church and
family institutions. Authors include such writers as Frederick Douglass and Maxine Hong Kingston.
Prerequisites: English 185 plus one additional course of relevant background.
Click on course title in the Class & Lab for more information about the course for that term.
fullname: Topics in American Racial and Multicultural Literatures
